meanings.definition: A small bag filled with beans or other material and used in games involving kicking.
meanings.sent1: During recess, the children played with footbags in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: I bought some footbags to play hacky sack with my friends.
meanings.sent3: The footbags rolled away when the wind blew, making the game more challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of footbags spilled out of the bag, scattering like confetti.
meanings.sent5: The colorful footbags jingled softly as they were kicked around.

meanings.definition: To kick a footbag in a game or sport.
meanings.sent1: He practiced his skills by footbagging in the park every evening.
meanings.sent2: We footbagged for hours, trying to beat each other's high score.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally footbagged the ball into her own goal, causing laughter all around.
meanings.sent4: The team footbagged their way to victory, scoring the winning goal in the last minute.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the players footbagged with precision and agility.
